Hi Community!I need to group Products (Sales Hub) into categories of failures.

"Fault A" can have "Product A, Product B and Product C"
"Fault B" can have "Product B, Product D and Product E"
"Fault C" can have "Product A, Product C and Product E"

I need to associate failures with products, I was thinking of using a custom object but I can't create associations with Products. Is there any possibility in your opinion?

To date I have used a select where "Faults" are the label and the Product IDs are the internal value, but it is not changeable in the future.

Any ideas?

Hello Everyone,

I have an interesting case in HubSpot. I am adding call records using the POST Call API and associating them with contacts. However, the associated records are also visible in the deals section. From the API, I am only creating associations between the calls and contacts, not with deals. I want to prevent these records from being seen in the deals section and from being associated with deals. How can I achieve this?

On our old WordPress website, when a customer submitted a form, the email notification sent to our team allowed us to simply hit “reply” and respond directly to the customer, as the email appeared to come from their address. For example, this is possible with Gravity Forms on WordPress.

Currently, with HubSpot, we cannot directly reply to a customer via form submission notification emails. Does anyone know a workaround for this? *Are there alternative form tools we could integrate with HubSpot?*

> I know that when someone submits a form in HubSpot the contact shows activity from before they submitted the form.
If they have cookies disabled I don’t believe we can provide that activity information because we wouldn’t have a reliable way to even associate that information with the person (aside from for example logging that the person went to the page that the form was on, because we know they filled out the form on that page). As much as HubSpot can feel magic, it’s not magic.

Something I’m not sure about is if a user changes their cookie preference. So lets say they opted in, then later opted out. I would assume we would have their analytics for while they were opted in but as soon as they opt out we no longer log things that would require cookies, a form submission and the page they filled out that form on would still be able to be inferred because they willingly filled out the form, no cookie required.
<@U7SL518D6> the response in the forum post from @kennedyp suggests that "views/activity" will be associated with a record once they accept cookies or fill out a form
it's unclear how that anonymous activity is associated with the contact in the end. If it's something like IP address that might have GDPR concerns

> Hey <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/user/viewprofilepage/user-id/294|@theAndreyK>! Great questions. If the visitor declines cookies, the anonymized views will never be associated with their record in HubSpot.
maybe I misinterpreted that response? it sounds like anonymous views/activity does get recorded and then gets associated with a record if they submit a form (the second sentence)

In the second sentence I believe he’s meaning only if you accept cookies can we associate your analytics with your record. We do not magically de-anonymize your history at the moment you opt into cookies.

also, <@U7SL518D6>, just for feedback you can maybe pass along, on our international teams there are concerns about both the naming and existence of analytics scripts before cookies are accepted. (the tracking pixel, <http://hs-analytics.net|hs-analytics.net>, <http://hsleadflows.net|hsleadflows.net>). I've explained that they either track anonymous data or relate to controlling future consent but there is some pushback)

Hey Pietro, a custom object cannot associate to the Products object. This is currently not possible. You would need to create the functionality based on what your requitements are and where you need to display the data. You might be able to use HubDB to create the categories and associate the Products, but this is all a manual process. If you need to automate things, you may need to use an external service or even something like a Serverless function that's trigger on each product update which automates updating your HubDB.
